intro: Henriettea macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered henriettea, is a member of the Ericaceae family, typically found in temperate regions. The plant has evergreen foliage with leathery, dark green leaves that provide year-round visual interest. Henriettea macrocalyx is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
